content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I executed the "average.py" file using the "execute_python_file" command and received the message "The average of the numbers is: 3.0". Then, I wrote a test file "test_average.py" using the "write_to_file" command and received the message "File written to successfully." The test file contains 3 test cases for the "calculate_average" function from the "average" module. All tests passed and the message "All tests passed!" was printed.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "What is the statute of limitations for personal injury in New York?"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["https://www.nycourts.gov/courthelp/goingtocourt/SOLchart.shtml", "https://www.goidelandsiegel.com/resources/statute-of-limitations/", "https://www.nolo.com/legal-encyclopedia/what-is-the-personal-injury-statute-of-limitations-in-new-york.html", "https://mosheslaw.com/statute-of-limitations-ny/", "https://www.rfogellaw.com/pi-statute-of-limitations-lifted-ny/", "https://www.brooklyn-accidents.com/article/statute-limitations-personal-injury-new-york/", "https://www.douglasandlondon.com/personal-injury-lawyers-nyc/what-is-the-statute-of-limitations-for-personal-injury-cases-in-new-york/", "https://www.nycbar.org/get-legal-help/article/personal-injury-and-accidents/statutes-limitation/"]', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_code", "args": {"code": "def calculate_average(numbers):\\n    total = sum(numbers)\\n    count = len(numbers)\\n    return total / count", "basename": "average.py"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command execute_python_code returned: ', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_code", "args": {"code": "from average import calculate_average\\n\\nnumbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]\\naverage = calculate_average(numbers)\\nprint(\'The average of the numbers is:\', average)", "basename": "test_average.py"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command execute_python_code returned: The average of the numbers is: 3.0\n', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://www.law.cornell.edu/wex/personal_injury", "question": "What is the standard of proof in a personal injury case?"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: providing information on personal injury claims, including the three grounds on which they can be brought (negligence, strict liability, and intentional wrongs), the causes of action that can lead to personal injury claims, and the damages that can be awarded if the plaintiff is successful. However, the text does not provide information on the standard of proof in a personal injury case.\n\nLinks: ['Learn more (https://www.cookiesandyou.com)', 'No thank you (https://www.law.cornell.edu/wex/personal_injury)', 'Skip to main content (https://www.law.cornell.edu/wex/personal_injury#content)', '\\n\\n (https://www.cornell.edu)', 'Cornell Law\\n\\t\\t\\t\\t\\tSchool (https://www.lawschool.cornell.edu/)']", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "international law research resources"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "average.py", "text": "def calculate_average(numbers):\\n    total = sum(numbers)\\n    count = len(numbers)\\n    average = total / count\\n    return average\\n\\nnumbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]\\naverage = calculate_average(numbers)\\nprint(\'The average of the numbers is:\', average)"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_file", "args": {"filename": "average.py"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command execute_python_file returned: The average of the numbers is: 3.0\n', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "test_average.py", "text": "from average import calculate_average\\n\\n# Test case 1\\nnumbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]\\nexpected_output = 3.0\\noutput = calculate_average(numbers)\\nassert output == expected_output, f\'Error: expected {expected_output}, but got {output}\'\\n\\n# Test case 2\\nnumbers = [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]\\nexpected_output = 0.0\\noutput = calculate_average(numbers)\\nassert output == expected_output, f\'Error: expected {expected_output}, but got {output}\'\\n\\n# Test case 3\\nnumbers = [2, 4, 6, 8, 10]\\nexpected_output = 6.0\\noutput = calculate_average(numbers)\\nassert output == expected_output, f\'Error: expected {expected_output}, but got {output}\'\\n\\nprint(\'All tests passed!\')"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_file", "args": {"filename": "test_average.py"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command execute_python_file returned: The average of the numbers is: 3.0\nAll tests passed!\n', type='action_result')]
"""
